title: Mini Apple Crumble
subtitle: Dessert Mission
desc: A lesson in texture. Learn to contrast soft, warm stewed fruit with a crunchy, buttery topping.

vocab.def: To cut food into small, precise cubes.
To incorporate fat into flour using fingertips.
To cook sugar until it turns brown and nutty.

steps.title: Precision Cutting
steps.desc: Wash the apple. Slice it into 4 sections around the core. Cut each section into strips, then across into cubes.
steps.note: Aim for 1cm cubes for even cooking.

steps.title: Seasoning
steps.desc: Place apple cubes in the foil cup. Sprinkle the Brown Sugar and Cinnamon over them.
steps.note: Toss gently to coat every cube.

steps.title: The Sand Texture
steps.desc: In a bowl, mix Flour and Sugar. Add Cold Butter. Rub the butter into the flour with your thumbs until it looks like wet beach sand.
steps.note: Physics: Friction melts butter, so work fast!

steps.title: Oats Integration
steps.desc: Stir the Rolled Oats into your sandy mixture. Do not rub them in; we want them whole for texture.

steps.title: Deployment
steps.desc: Pour the crumble mix over the apples. Do not press it down! Let it sit loosely on top to allow steam to escape.

title: The Power Sandwich
subtitle: Lunch Mission
desc: The ultimate savory stack. Master the art of layering flavors and frying the perfect egg.

vocab.def: The hissing sound of food frying in hot oil.
A flat tool used for lifting and flipping.
To fit parts together to build a whole.

steps.title: Pan Calibration
steps.desc: Heat a non-stick pan on medium heat. Add a knob of butter. Wait until it stops foaming—that means it's ready.

steps.title: Egg Mechanics
steps.desc: Crack the egg gently into the pan. Season with salt immediately. Cook for 2 minutes until the white is solid but yolk is soft.

steps.title: Toasting (Maillard)
steps.desc: While egg cooks, toast your bread slices until golden. Spread mayo on one side of each slice.
steps.note: Mayo acts as a moisture barrier.

steps.title: Logic Stacking
steps.desc: Order: Bread (Bottom) -> Lettuce -> Tomato -> Egg -> Cheese -> Bread (Top).
steps.note: Physics: The hot egg melts the cheese.

steps.title: The Cross-Cut
steps.desc: Press the sandwich down gently with your palm. Use a serrated knife to cut diagonally from corner to corner.

title: Tropical Fizz
subtitle: Chemistry Mission
desc: A lesson in density and states of matter. Create a refreshing, gradient-colored drink.

vocab.def: Gas bubbles (CO2) dissolved in liquid.
How heavy a liquid is. Syrup sinks!
To decorate a drink to make it look pro.

steps.title: Thermal Protection
steps.desc: Fill your glass to the very top with ice cubes. Packed ice melts slower, keeping your drink chemically stable (cold).
steps.note: Don't use wet hands for ice.

steps.title: The Heavy Layer
steps.desc: Pour the Orange Syrup directly over the ice. Watch it sink to the bottom because it is denser than water.

steps.title: Carbon Injection
steps.desc: Tilt the glass slightly. Pour the Soda Water slowly down the side of the glass to preserve the bubbles.
steps.note: Don't pour directly on ice (kills fizz).

steps.title: Activation
steps.desc: Insert a straw or long spoon. Stir GENTLY only once to mix the gradient slightly.

steps.title: Aromatic Garnish
steps.desc: Clap the mint leaves between your hands to release oils. Place on top near the straw.

title: Anti-Gravity Pancakes
subtitle: Breakfast Mission
desc: Master the viscosity of batter and the timing of the perfect flip. Fluffy and golden.

vocab.def: To beat mixture quickly to add air.
A semi-liquid mixture of flour and milk.
Baking powder creates bubbles when hot.

steps.title: Dry Team Assembly
steps.desc: In a large bowl, whisk together Flour, Baking Powder, Sugar, and Salt. Create a 'well' (hole) in the center.

steps.title: Wet Team Assembly
steps.desc: In a separate jug, mix Milk, Egg, and Melted Butter. Pour this into the center of the dry bowl.
steps.note: Don't scramble the egg in hot butter!

steps.title: The Gentle Fold
steps.desc: Mix until just combined. Lumps are okay! If you over-mix, the pancakes will be tough (gluten formation).

steps.title: Bubble Indicator
steps.desc: Pour ladle of batter onto hot pan. Wait. Do not touch! When bubbles appear on the surface and pop, it is time.

steps.title: The Flip
steps.desc: Slide spatula under. Flip with confidence in one motion. Cook 1 more minute on the second side.

title: Code-Red Spaghetti
subtitle: Dinner Mission
desc: Handle boiling water safely and learn the true meaning of 'Al Dente'.

vocab.def: Italian for 'To the tooth'. Firm, not mushy.
To cook gently just below boiling point.
To remove water using a colander.

steps.title: The Rolling Boil
steps.desc: Fill pot with water. Turn heat to High. Wait for big bubbles (Rolling Boil). Add the Salt now.
steps.note: Water should taste like the sea.

steps.title: Pasta Submersion
steps.desc: Add spaghetti. As it softens, push it down gently. Stir immediately so it doesn't stick together.
steps.note: Don't break the pasta in half!

steps.title: The Timing
steps.desc: Boil for 9-10 minutes. Taste one strand. It should have a tiny white dot in the center (Al Dente).

steps.title: Sauce Fusion
steps.desc: Drain water (save a tiny bit!). Return pasta to pot. Pour in Tomato Sauce and Oregano. Mix on low heat for 1 minute.

steps.title: Plating
steps.desc: Twist pasta onto plate. Sprinkle heavily with Parmesan Cheese and top with a fresh Basil leaf.

title: The Golden Fold
subtitle: Egg Mission
desc: Learn temperature control. A fluffy, cheesy omelette that isn't burnt.

vocab.def: To mix fast to add air bubbles.
To move the pan so liquid flows.
To bend the food over itself.

steps.title: Aeration
steps.desc: Crack eggs into a bowl. Add Milk, Salt, Pepper. Whisk aggressively until the mixture is uniform yellow and bubbly.

steps.title: Heat Control
steps.desc: Heat pan on Medium-Low. Add butter. If it hisses loudly, it's too hot! Wait for gentle bubbles.

steps.title: The Pour & Tilt
steps.desc: Pour eggs in. Use spatula to pull cooked edges to center, tilting pan so raw egg flows to the empty spots.

steps.title: The Filling
steps.desc: When the top is still slightly wet (custardy), sprinkle Cheese and Onions on ONE HALF of the circle only.

steps.title: The Fold
steps.desc: Slide spatula under the empty half. Fold it over the cheese half. Press down gently. Serve immediately.

title: Rainbow Logic Salad
subtitle: Knife Skills Mission
desc: Practice safe cutting techniques and color theory. No cooking required.

vocab.def: To remove the green leafy top of a strawberry.
To mix two liquids (honey & lime) together.
To mix salad gently without crushing it.

steps.title: The Claw Grip
steps.desc: Safety First! Curl your fingers like a claw when holding fruit. Cut the strawberries into quarters.

steps.title: Peel & Slice
steps.desc: Peel the Kiwi/Mango. Slice into bite-sized pieces. Try to make all pieces the same size.

steps.title: Dressing Chemistry
steps.desc: In a small cup, mix Honey and Lime Juice. Stir fast until it becomes a thin syrup.

steps.title: Combine
steps.desc: Place all fruit in a large bowl. Pour dressing over the top.
steps.note: Don't do this until you are ready to eat.

steps.title: The Toss
steps.desc: Use two spoons to gently lift and drop the fruit to coat it in dressing. Top with Mint.

title: Binary Choco-Cookies
subtitle: Baking Mission
desc: Chemistry in action. Turn dough into crispy-chewy discs of happiness.

vocab.def: To mix butter and sugar until pale and fluffy.
Gentle mixing to avoid tough cookies.
The process where cookies harden.

steps.title: Creaming Method
steps.desc: Mash soft butter and sugar together with a spoon/fork until it looks like light yellow paste.

steps.title: Bind It
steps.desc: Add the Egg and Vanilla. Mix until smooth.

steps.title: Dry Integration
steps.desc: Add Flour and Baking Soda. Mix slowly. Stop when no white powder is left. Add Choco Chips.

steps.title: Spacing Logic
steps.desc: Scoop balls of dough onto tray. Leave 5cm space between them. They will spread when hot.
steps.note: Crowded cookies merge into one giant cookie.

steps.title: Hardening Phase
steps.desc: Bake at 180°C for 10-12 mins. Edges should be brown, center soft. Let them cool on tray.
steps.note: They are soft when hot, hard when cold.

title: Brain-Boost Smoothie
subtitle: Blender Mission
desc: High-speed physics. Turn solids into liquids using a vortex.

vocab.def: Short bursts of power to break ice.
The tornado shape inside the blender.
How thick a liquid is.

steps.title: Loading Order
steps.desc: Pour Milk in FIRST. Then add soft stuff (Yogurt). Add Frozen Fruit LAST.
steps.note: Liquids at the bottom help blades spin.

steps.title: Security Check
steps.desc: Put the lid on tight. Hold the lid down with your hand.
steps.note: Exploding smoothies make a huge mess.

steps.title: Pulse Phase
steps.desc: Press 'Pulse' 3 times to break the big frozen chunks.

steps.title: Vortex Phase
steps.desc: Turn to High speed. Watch for the 'Vortex' (tornado) in the middle. Blend for 20 seconds.

steps.title: Texture Check
steps.desc: If it's too thick, add a splash of milk and blend again. Pour and drink immediately.
